Job_Title: SVP - Team Lead - Energy Renewables Infrastructure
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Corporate and Investment Banking provides corporate customers with a full range of commercial banking products and services, including cash management services, current accounts, time deposits, trade finance, working capital finance, term loans and foreign exchange. Through our continued commitment, DBS has cultivated long-standing relationships with its customers in the region that are based on account relationship management, service differentiation, product development and rigorous credit standards. Responsibilities Lead, mentor and motivate a team of 4-5 global industry coverage bankers, with candidate being directly responsible for the team's portfolio P&L performance across the following key products: Loans, Cash, Trade, Treasury and Markets and Investment Banking products (including Equity Capital Markets, Debt Capital Markets and Strategic Advisory) and across DBS geographies; Grow portfolio earnings and enhance portfolio ROE through cross-sell of Cash, Trade, Treasury & Markets and Investment Banking products and solutions as follows: Oversee the development and execution of strategic account plans for existing client portfolio with product partners, with at least semi-annual reviews, and a special focus on; The Digital agenda: To acquire new cash management mandates & supply chain mandates, working closely with product partners to ensure proper execution of such mandates; The Sustainability agenda: To capture sustainability advisory, loans and capital markets opportunities working closely with Sustainability Team. Identify New-To-Bank client targets and develop/implement acquisition plans Work with the Executive Directors and Managing Directors of ERI to originate investment banking and advisory mandates Ensure proper management of existing portfolio of customers across products and geographies, especially for large accounts with heavy demands on day-to-day operational handling.. Work with DBS Geographies to grow DBS ERI brand and regional industry wallet revenue by raising awareness of industry developments and its ensuing opportunities and risk, deal flow and deal structures. Jointly target new clients and drive joint account planning for existing portfolio Ensure regular client engagement at both the working level as well as C-suite meetings. These should be supported by timely pre-meeting briefing notes with relevant talking points and actionable call reports Ensure quality, accuracy and relevance of pitches to clients by product partners Lead the monthly preparation of Mid-Month Reviews to Senior Management detailing P&L and risk profile of the portfolio, ensuring accuracy of data and quality of analysis to drive direction of portfolio. Proactive monitoring and management of accounts, being alert to credit deterioration or improvement, and taking timely action including elevation to senior management and Credit. Oversee the preparation of credit memos ensuring accuracy, timeliness and supported by sufficient depth of analysis and synthesized insights and coherent recommendations. Ensure timely and accurate credit reviews of the whole portfolio; Evaluate financial models with P&L, B/S & cash-flow projections based on sound business and market assumptions with high level of competence. Oversee loan & security documentation and negotiation with high degree of competence Cultivate a strong people culture, with DBS values and building a highly-motivated team. Develop and monitor clear KPIs, with clear development goals for each direct report Drive talent development and internal mobility including overseas assignment. Craft action plan to address areas revealed by DBS' employee engagement scores and ensure timely follow-up of such actions Requirements Bachelor Degree with at least 12 years' relevant experience. Previous working experience in Energy, Renewables & Infrastructure industry will be a pre-requisite. Good knowledge of various financial solutions products especially in driving regional business and connectivity across different geographies Good understanding of credit risks and ability to independently conduct discussions with credit / risk management teams would be preferrable Confidence in pitching ideas at the level of the CEOs and CFOs Highly resourceful individual who should also be a team player Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Area Product Owner - Data Management and Governance (Associate Director/ Director)
Job_Descriptions: Area Product Owner - Data Management and Governance (Associate Director/ Director) At Bank of Singapore, we are constantly on the lookout for exceptional individuals to join our team. We promote a culture of openness, teamwork and fairness. Most importantly, we invest in our people through our programmes that develop them on both professional and personal levels. Besides attractive remuneration packages, we offer non-financial benefits and opportunities to develop your potential within OCBC Group’s global network of subsidiaries and offices. If you have passion, drive and the will to succeed, rise to the challenge today! Bank of Singapore opens doors to new opportunities. Start your career with Bank of Singapore as a Data Analyst, Python (Associate Director/ Director) in our Data Hub ! Bank of Singapore has defined an ambitious roadmap for accelerating its data strategy through 1) the implementation of a Data Analytics Platform for the bank 2) the implementation of a Hub and Spoke organization for analytics with the Data Hub, as a center of excellence, supporting the business spokes of each department 3) a strong while agile data governance ensuring data quality, privacy and ethical use of data. Organizational Context Reporting to the Data Tribe Lead, and located within the Data Hub organization, The Area Product Owner (APO) for Data Management and Governance is responsible for driving the implementation of enterprise-wide data management and governance toolset roadmap to realise governance policies that are set in place. The APO is responsible for the product vision and roadmap, works with squads and project teams to ensure timely delivery. The PO is a persistent role that goes beyond an individual project and will work with various System and Process Owners that contribute to or are part of the overall Product Area. Along with the Data Management Policy, the Data Tribe, and Group Data Management Office, the APO will oversee the definition, selection, and implementation of the bank Data Management Technology Stack defining a cluster of technology-based tools to efficiently govern and monitor data quality, consistency, accuracy, confidentiality and access, across various data domains (incl. customer, product and across geographies). Working on the operating model, establish guidelines, processes, and accountability measures to ensure that technology implemented is right-fitted against Bank of Singapore's scale and data ambitions, pivoting when necessary as the bank's data maturity evolves. The APO needs to have good transformational change, stakeholder management, data management and governance implementation knowledge. Primary Responsibilities Responsible for building the bank's Data Management technology and tool product roadmap, creating a blueprint for end-to-end data management across the data supply chain, Partner with Bank of Singapore and OCBC Group Data Management offices to understand and realise directives set for data management and governance through technology and process improvements. Provide guidance, options and alternatives for solutioning on relevant Data Management and Governance tools and applications to address business demand in collaboration with IT, Data Hub and Group OCBC Team. Streamline and develop data management and governance processes required, taking into consideration of available market and incumbent toolsets Participate in Bank-wide initiatives to embed data governance and data protection practices into existing enterprise-wide policies and processes. Participate in the development of data standards incorporating industry best practices across Reference data, Master data and Metadata. Localize and contribute to OCBC Group Data Management Office initiatives As system owner for key marketing technology platforms: drive the strategic agenda and system optimization for the entire organization. Ensure both Client Data Entitlement and Martech Platform are used and developed according to a sound and cost-effective business logic providing the best outcome to our internal customers Localize Group standards and best practices for implementation in areas such as Data Quality Management and Data Classification across Bank of Singapore's data domains Engage with Data User community to obtain feedback and map out incremental improvement roadmaps to address data issues Contribute as standing member in Data Management Committee to provide updates and communicating target state for Bank of Singapore's Data Management operating model Qualifications Requirements Degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science or Technology Possession of MBA degree, relevant certifications or qualification is advantageous. Leadership stakeholder management Familiar with the principle of agile methodology, certification as Scrum master or Product owner Experience in managing complex, cross-functional technology-related projects Possess excellent problem-solving skills. Proven track record in Data Management or related areas such as Data Governance, Data Quality Management, Metadata Management Familiarity with data governance and management principles with experience in actuating policies and procedures through a combination of technology and operating model A driven self-starter who is delivery focused and possesses strong communication, influencing and presentation skills Robust stakeholder management skills and good interpersonal skills. Ability to work confidently and collaboratively with cross-functional stakeholders of varying seniority. Well organized with a natural inclination for conceptual thinking, planning strategy and solutioning; able to multi-task and meet multiple deadlines Ability to work independently, is pragmatic and enjoys high energy levels Thrive in a fast-paced environment and be able to adapt to complex demands in a diverse culture Knowledge of at least 1 data management and governance product suite or equivalent technologies.

Job_Title: Associate, Business Data Analytics Specialist, Private Banking, Consumer Banking Group

Coupled with partnerships within the DBS network and with global institutions, we strive to build long-term relationships with our Private Banking clients in Asia by providing them with high quality, timely and extensive wealth management, investment and financial solutions. Responsibilities Data Analytics Drive insights and data points for MIS and sales management strategy Using data-driven approach to support and work together with stakeholders on scorecard and sales management objectives Perform regular and ad-hoc data analysis on front office sales and productivity attributes, depending on business needs and strategy Drive productivity Improve strategy team's productivity through workflow/process enhancements Drive digital adoption by automating existing data extraction/maintenance tasks and processes. Projects Participate in data projects for Investment Advisory front office by providing requirements and collaborating with other departments to deliver project objectives Maintenance and support of front office portfolio tools: Perform regular data maintenance for in-house portfolio tools. First contact point for front office tools data queries Requirements Proficiency in Tableau, MS Excel and VBA is a must. Shows interest in wealth management space Team player with excellent communication skills Strong numerical and analytical skills Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job Description About Meltwater: Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. Our employees embody the ‘work hard, play hard’ spirit, and we are lucky to have some of the best and most talented people out there. We pride ourselves on taking great people and helping them do extraordinary things in a dynamic, global environment that fosters positivity, entrepreneurship, and teamwork. With 20 years of experience in the field of online media monitoring, Meltwater is a global leader in media intelligence and social analytics SaaS solutions - helping to bridge the gap between Public Relations, Communications, and Marketing departments with an all-in-one solution powered by AI-driven insights. Through Meltwater's platforms, our clients are well equipped to stay on top of billions of online conversations and extract relevant insights - allowing them to strategically manage their brands and stay ahead of their competition. With 55 offices and 2,000 employees worldwide, Meltwater is a truly global partner to over 30,000 of the world’s most respected brands which rely on Meltwater to help inform their MarCom strategies and decision making. Role: Sales and Marketing Intern This is a rare opportunity to join the world’s largest media monitoring company, Meltwater’s Singapore office as an intern (Full time and Part-time) and gain incredible exposure to the workings of an organisation at the junction of social media, news, and business. Watch video: Worklife in Meltwater As part of our internship program, you will be part of a team that prides itself on building an engaging, focused, and fun place for our people to grow their careers. About the Internship Program: We are offering internships in 2 streams: Business and Media Analysis Example of projects you'll work on: Content writing - Write content for Linkedin Campaigns, Social media, and Infographics Account Analysis - Audit client accounts for setup and user experience Business Development - Prospect mapping and research Media Analyst - Mine insights from structured data and report writing on current, relevant and real-time issues What you'll do: Get upskilled on the award-winning Meltwater platform (including a LinkedIn certification!) Work on real-life and current media issues for real brands and organisations Learn essential business communication skills Get exposure to Meltwater’s global footprint What to expect: A broader understanding of the global media landscape Increased business acumen as you’ll be working with clients in Marketing, PR, Comms and Digital (to name a few!) from a range of industries Learn to use the Meltwater PR and Social Suite Learning about how a SaaS company works across all business units Understanding how to drive the industry to embrace social media Who you are: In your final year of University Available for at least 3 days a week during office hours Have a standout academic record You are ambitious and want to kick-start your career! Internship period: Flexible based off university requirements Visit our Careers Page: https://careers.meltwater.com/ At the end of the internship program, 2 candidates will be offered full-time positions in Meltwater. Who are we? Founded in Oslo in 2001 by Jørn Lyseggen, Meltwater’s mission is to provide outside insight, to help companies make better, faster, more informed decisions using data. We have grown to over 60 offices globally, and have more than 30,000 companies who use the Meltwater media intelligence platform. Our recent Listing, Acquisitions, and Awards As a company we prioritize innovation and evolution, driving constant learning and development not only in our people but in our investments on both a local and international scale. In the last year alone, we have become a listed company on the Euronext Growth Oslo, acquired the social media intelligence company, Linkfluence, along with the social influencer marketing company, Klear. Our Values Meltwater’s people are an integral element to our success. Our culture is based on a fundamental belief in people and the potential they possess. We create an environment where our people are motivated by their colleagues to discover new strengths and shine even brighter. We keep our entrepreneurial spirit alive within every team and every department— delighting in hard work and relishing the feeling of accomplishment that comes with it.

Job_Title: AVP, Marketing Technology, Conversion Optimisation Specialist , Consumer Banking Group - (WD31423)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business - they were made just right for you. Responsibilities Deliver data-driven insights that inform, influence, and optimize marketing strategy and execution aligned with business objectives. Drive and manage comprehensive and advanced analytics that improves traffic generation and conversion across the sites(web & mobile) and platforms and actively report and improve respective Traffic Channels KPI's. Collaborate and support Performance Marketing, Country Marketing, Tech & Delivery team to drive Mar tech value proposition. Execute data-driven marketing use cases with countries by enhancing customer segmentation strategy through bringing together data, qualitative studies, customer research, customer motivations/ needs info, leverage marketing technology capabilities, connecting the dots across various initiatives to amplify business results. Implement a framework to balance personalization, data-driven marketing with evolving customer privacy landscape Closely collaborate with the country marketing team to share findings and insights on Traffic, Media, aligning deep dives for DBS channel forecasts, campaigns, and pre-post-mortems, traffic acquisition strategies & overall business objectives. Directly manage the efficiency, data-driven performance tracking capabilities in delivering a data-driven funnel analysis that can identify all digital engagements, lead acquisition, and customer journeys Proactive monitoring of the market for emerging technologies that can improve marketing performance and personalization. Understand business and technology requirements and connect the dots to deliver the MarTech strategy to fulfil business objectives. Develop best practices to share with in-country marketing teams in Singapore, India, Indonesia, China, Taiwan, and Hong Kong Be the interface between Marketing and Technology teams to build the capabilities related to MarTech, including evaluation, recommendation on build vs. buy, budgeting, testing, rollout, and governance Develop and implement data capabilities, consolidations, and best practice toolsets and frameworks that allow continuous tracking and optimization of web & mobile traffic. Identify, suggest and implement new opportunities to drive growth through traffic optimization. Drive Traffic analytics capabilities building through the application of the full set of advanced analytics methodologies to optimize data analysis. This includes framing of business needs, data, and KPIs exploration and benchmarking as well as descriptive, predictive and prescriptive modelling. Advise stakeholders in your area of responsibility on digital analytics to define goals, select appropriate KPIs, monitor performance and derive trends and opportunities. Qualifications Minimum 10 years of experience with 7-8 yrs of relevant experience in the marketing technology space and delivering value to marketing Strong digital analytics experience, preferably 4-6 years' experience using either Adobe experience cloud ,Google, CDP(Tealium audienceStream, Segment, AEP),DMP(AAM, Lotame, Google Audience Centre),Salesforce Marketing Cloud or equivalent MarTech knowledge. Bachelor's degree or above in any of the following disciplines: engineering, Statistics, Economics or Business Administration Proven ability to communicate insights and recommendations to senior stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, both in verbal and written formats Strong capability of managing and prioritising several competing tasks for different stakeholders Excellent analytical, technical and/or statistical skills with proven ability to translate large volumes of data into meaningful narratives An influencer who communicates clearly and frequently to both technical analysts and non-technical business leaders Intellectually curious, consistently seeking and developing new opportunities autonomously Growth mindset - eager to learn and try new things, adapt and thrive in a fast-paced dynamic environment Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Active participation in delivery squad from Inception workshop, Development sprint cycle, Deployment activities and Post Support Work closely with business, technology and other relevant stakeholders to ensure that all stakeholders and engaged and actively managed Business Analysis Gather, clarify and study business requirements Perform data analysis and data mapping Prepare, review test scenarios and data for completeness and coverage Provide clarity of requirements through all phases in agile delivery squad, from Inception workshop, Development Sprint cycle, Deployment and Post support Program Coordination Support program governance for Workbenches Establish a strong program governance strategy & change management mindset through effective communication, collaboration and engagement with all stakeholders Ensure governance on roles & responsibilities of the various program roles, and program success-metrics Requirements: Bachelor Degree with a minimum 3 years of experience in working with program management and / or business analysis is preferred. Experience in managing large scale programs across the organization Experience with agile sprints Track record of operating independently and delivering results, embracing ambiguity, demonstrating creativity, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a high organized manner Conflict management skills with ability to work under pressure Passion for building communities and connecting individuals Excellent facilitation, presentation and written communication skills Good relationship management skills; ability to communicate well with diverse stakeholder groups Highly proficient in MS Office suite of products Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: VP/AVP, One Rewards: Rewards Manager, Consumer Banking Group | (WD30352)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function DBS is a leading Asia bank servicing our clients for over 50 years in the 18 markets we operate in. Besides providing a comprehensive suite of financial solutions, our award-winning digital solutions are targeted at our clients as people are the heart of everything, we do in DBS. We are committed to deliver banking that is simple and hassle free and embed our digital solutions in client’s everyday life as we expand on our ecosystem’s partnership. Job Purpose In our team at One Rewards, we collaborate with our key stakeholders in technology and business (product) to deliver a Rewards solution that rewards customers for all interactions with the bank. These interactions allow customer to earn and redeem DBS points through acquisition and usage of DBS products and services across various touchpoints within the DBS product ecosystem and well as partner programmes. One of the key responsibilities of this job function will be to provide expertise and detailed knowledge acquired from both technology and business stakeholders to build and groom user stories, ensure end to end execution of the user acceptance testing using both manual and automation tools and provide quality and timely output before release to market. The delivery of these highly complex and sophisticated reward solutions requires a capable and highly motivated individual who excel in stakeholder engagements and familiar with project management to deliver successful outcomes for the organisation with in-depth consideration to the customer journey experience. You will be required to collaborate widely with the various applications technical team supporting our delivery as well as our business counterparts on update. As the bank continue to grow and invest in digital platform and increasing our digital suite of services, testing scope have expanded, platform have become more complex thus there need to have more creative and sustainable way of ensuring that our services delivered, both old and new remain robust and make banking invisible and joyful to our customers. Responsibilities The One Rewards Programme is a bank-wide cross business project that encompasses stakeholders from CBG and IBG. This role requires you to be able to strategize, plan and manage various feature requirements across businesses, understanding their needs and priorities. Manage the core rewards requirements for the One Rewards system Work with business and planning teams to manage P&L and rewards costs To coordinate and gather business priorities and features to be built as backlog Ideate, build and run experiments – test and learn and provide insights Understanding of loyalty in the market as well as DBS products is a necessity To have the ability to communicate vision, strategy and translate that to and recommendation for features priority Skills Flexible, positive and results oriented. Works well with changing timelines and priorities and can proactively manage up. Works with a sense of urgency and makes efforts to motivate others towards common goals. Outstanding written and verbal communications skills, including the ability to develop clear, insightful PowerPoint presentations, internal briefs and reports. Demonstrated ability to gather and synthesize complex information, make sound tactical decisions, and communicate such information in a clear, simple way to a variety of audiences, ranging from senior executives to working-level technical specialists. Ability to formulate and communicate strategies rooted in deep knowledge of product, consumer, and market factors, with the ability to think creatively and outside the box Self-starter who identifies areas of opportunity and drives forward efficiencies, processes, and goals forward with cross-functional stakeholders. Technical aptitude: Demonstrated ability to work with complex products or capabilities, the ideal candidate will have an existing basic understanding of mobile and digital payment technologies. Must have resilience and the ability to work well under pressure with minimum guidance Quick learner, adaptable to changes on project needs and good team player who take initiative to help team to complete assigned task Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and projects Requirements Degree holder with relevant experience, preferably in Consumer Banking, Payments and/or mobile/Internet Banking with strong business acumen is an advantage. Strong IT background preferably with experience in implementing system projects. Has minimal 8 - 10 years of experience in business analysis, requirements gathering and scripting; and close interaction with business users Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a positive working attitude. Ability to work and cope under pressure with accuracy and commitment, manage complex environment such as testing and closure of issues. A good team player who can work well with product specialist, operational teams and technical teams Extremely meticulous and systematic with an eye for detail Possess the ability to prioritize and categorize requirements or issues to ensure that effective delivery of projects or enhancements Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Proposal Writer The Sales Support Specialist is a seasoned professional role. Applies in-depth disciplinary knowledge, contributing to the development of new techniques and the improvement of processes and work-flow for the area or function. Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the function and overall business. Evaluates moderately complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact, where development of an approach/taking of an action involves weighing various alternatives and balancing potentially conflicting situations using multiple sources of information. Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex and dynamic material from multiple sources. Excellent communication and diplomacy skills are required. Regularly assumes informal/formal leadership role within teams. Involved in coaching and training of new recruits. Job_Descriptions: Company: Qualcomm Global Trading Pte. Ltd. Job Area: Engineering Group, Engineering Group > Hardware Engineering General Summary Company Profile: Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. In order to drive our next phase of growth in Automotive, we are expanding the Product Development and Test Engineering group at our Test Center of Excellence (TCE) in Singapore. The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for Automotive application. We work with Design, System, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products. The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for mobile application. We work with Design, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products. Major Responsibilities: Job responsibilities for the position include designing and debugging of test interface HW (loadboard), test SW (test program) development, HW/SW integration, characterization plan development, first silicon debug, process experiment (split) definition, multiple-source fab matching, device characterization, data analysis, product documentation/presentation, test limit (guardband) generation; driving failure analysis to completion, yield variance control. The job scope also requires the engineer to drive for short term and long term test time reduction and yield improvement to meet set goals without compromising production quality for multiple projects in parallel. Min Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process. Wafer fabrication fundamentals are a plus. Knowledge and hands on experience with statistical analysis software package and techniques, quality and reliability testing. Strong software skills (Java, C/C++, Visual Basic, Perl, Python etc.) for programming and debugging test codes. Strong verbal and written communications skills. Able to organize effectively and document work thoroughly while working with local and remote teams. Experience with presenting product and test data driven decisions to management to drive actions. Physical Requirements • Frequently transports between offices, buildings, and campuses up to ½ mile. • Frequently transports and installs equipment up to 5 lbs. • Performs required tasks at various heights (e.g., standing or sitting). • Monitors and utilizes computers and test equipment for more than 6 hours a day. • Continuous communication which includes the comprehension of information with colleagues, customers, and vendors both in person and remotely. Minimum Qualifications Education: Bachelors - Computer Science, Bachelors - Engineering, Bachelors - Information Systems Work Experiences: Certifications: Skills: Preferred Qualifications Education: Work Experiences: 1+ years experience with hardware design and measurement instruments such as oscilloscopes, spectrum analyzers, RF tools, etc. ,1+ years experience utilizing schematic capture and circuit simulation software. ,1+ years experience with circuit design (e.g., digital, analog, RF). Job_Title: AVP/SA, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad Customer Profiles, Gamification and Engagement, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Descriptions: AVP/SA, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad Customer Profiles, Gamification and Engagement, Consumer Banking Group Business Function: DBS is a leading Asia bank servicing our clients for over 50 years in the 18 markets we operate in. Besides providing a comprehensive suite of financial solutions, our award-winning digital solutions are targeted at our clients as people are the heart of everything, we do in DBS. We are committed to deliver banking that is simple and hassle free and embed our digital solutions in client's everyday life as we expand on our ecosystem's partnership. Job purpose: In our team at One Rewards, we collaborate with our key stakeholders in technology and business (product) to deliver a Rewards solution that rewards customers for all interactions with the bank. These interactions allow customer to earn and redeem DBS points through acquisition and usage of DBS products and services across various touchpoints within the DBS product ecosystem and well as partner programmes. One of the key responsibilities of this job function will be to provide expertise and detailed knowledge acquired from both technology and business stakeholders to build and groom user stories, ensure end to end execution of the user acceptance testing using both manual and automation tools and provide quality and timely output before release to market. The delivery of these highly complex and sophisticated reward solutions requires a capable and highly motivated individual who excel in stakeholder engagements and familiar with project management to deliver successful outcomes for the organisation with in-depth consideration to the customer journey experience. You will be required to collaborate widely with the various applications technical team supporting our delivery as well as our business counterparts on update. As the bank continue to grow and invest in digital platform and increasing our digital suite of services, testing scope have expanded, platform have become more complex thus there need to have more creative and sustainable way of ensuring that our services delivered, both old and new remain robust and make banking invisible and joyful to our customers. Responsibilities Strategize from a bank wide approach, across CBG and IBG to create synergy across feature requirements from different business units and manage earn and redemption interactions consolidated at a customer level. To manage Squad under Customer Profiles, Gamification and Engagement covering features including but not limited to: Creation of customer level Customer Profile Dashboard with demographic and psychographic data that will be visible to customer and serving agents: Availing customer level view of parameters such as product holdings, tenure, banking segment, member tiering status that will allow for accelerated benefits accorded through these parameters Lifetime earnings (rewards/investment), rewards history, campaign registered, membership status, vouchers available, merchant stamp cards Rewards like 'badges' for spend/frequency of activity/products Time bound or action-based privileges Rewards through gaming platform through engines that drive engagement and reward through probability (e.g. spin the wheel), achievement - spend/transaction number, count - 50th person/first person every hour, etc Flags to enable the ability to reward customer based on segmentation, product holdings, user behaviour and preferences Intelligent targeting based on previous behaviour, propensity modelling To allow for community engagement through anonymous or self-selected participants with virtual gifting elements or milestone group rewards The ability to understand Gamification concepts and interactions between gamification engines and core systems workflows is necessary. You will need to be able to translate business requirements that calls for multi-leg game loops into user stories and propose solutions that will translate into measurable business outcomes. Trigger of event-based customer communication would be an extension of that interaction. A detailed understanding of the current business systems with a view data ingestion between current and new systems You will also be expected to work with a team of Product Owners, ensuring efficiency and effective delivery of features and requirements, keeping in mind the strategic intent of the One Rewards programme. Work closely with country business stakeholders, channel and product teams. Lead and be responsible for writing and developing Business Requirement Document (BRD) / User Stories. Work closely with design team to conceptualize and optimize customer journey. Review the technical Functional Specifications Document (FSD)/Narratives/ User Stories with technology counterparts to ensure that these specifications are designed in accordance to business requirements. Incorporating feature request into product roadmap, grooming and proritising backlog. Scheduling releases and coordinating Sprints Follow progress of work and address production issues during sprints Supervising a team of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) testers. Delivery lead should ensure that UAT test plans and test cases / automation are executed within the stipulated UAT schedule. Support post-implementation tasks such user training to touch-points, production problem investigation, escalation, and resolution Self-starter with strong business acumen, independent and able to rise to challenges and meet deadlines effectively Ensure customer issues are resolved within the SLA and prompt follow-up to ensure closure in issues To manage between system capability and business needs and balance the timelines and deliverables. Requirements Degree holder with relevant experience, preferably in Consumer Banking, Payments and/or mobile/Internet Banking with strong business acumen is an advantage. Strong IT background preferably with experience in implementing system projects. Has minimal 6 - 8 years of experience in business analysis, requirements gathering and scripting; and close interaction with business users Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a positive working attitude. Ability to work and cope under pressure with accuracy and commitment, manage complex environment such as testing and closure of issues. A good team player who can work well with product specialist, operational teams and technical teams Extremely meticulous and systematic with an eye for detail Possess the ability to prioritize and categorize requirements or issues to ensure that effective delivery of projects or enhancements Skills (Non-Technical) Must have resilience and the ability to work well under pressure with minimum guidance Quick learner, adaptable to changes on project needs and good team player who take initiative to help team to complete assigned task Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and projects Strong communication skills as need to interaction closely with various stakeholders from product, delivery lead to technical counterparts across other applications Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Senior Associate/Associate, Product Designer, Middle Office Technology, Group Design
Job_Descriptions: The Product Designers we really want to hire deliver real value to real users. In other words, they design stuff that gets built. If you are passionate about bringing simplicity to complex information systems - we have a challenge for you. What you'll be doing You'll spend most of your time trying to simplify very complex products and ideas in order to reduce employee pain points - by looking into processes, policies, procedures and systems that support planning and operation of the bank. It may be an uphill battle, but it's worth it. If you succeed, your designs will enable thousands of people to serve millions of our customers better. We say that, if you can work in a bank, you can work anywhere. Don't worry if you don't have the relevant finance/domain knowledge, it's something you will pick up along the way, just be sure you're eager to learn and be immersed in the fintech world. Besides, we're a nice bunch of people. Around here, we go out of our way to help one another. Here's what your week might look like You'll spend time with our wonderful research team. Together you'll try to understand the business goals of your project and, more often than not, meet the stakeholders to redefine the problem statement. Once you know where you're going, it's time to tackle the behemoth tech systems and legal restrictions of a bank. Your product manager will become your best friend. You'll message the tech lead more than your parents. You'll get a crash course in finance law. We do respect the privacy of people with headphones-on, trying to avoid eye contact. So you'll have the time to actually produce work you're proud of. We want to hire people who have opinions, believe in their ideas and are willing to fight for them. But we also want people who can recognise when a better argument or solution is put before them. All of us participate in user testing, and so will you. Like we said, producing good work is not good enough if it doesn't get built. We love you, Dribble/Behance. It's not you, it's us. You will meet stakeholders from different departments Product Designer - MOT Finance 2 and articulate your ideas so clearly that you'll become an honorary Toastmaster. To prepare for those meetings you'll need to check the latest relevant data. Before you know it, it will be Friday and time for team dinner, drinks or Creative Day (we do something fun and creative together once a month). Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have You're an end-to-end designer: you can turn high-level requirements into well-posed problem statements, wireframes, prototypes or Powerpoints for the management teams. You can talk confidently and clearly about design and build lasting relationships with our stakeholders. And you're not afraid to improvise-to think on your feet-when required. You can brainstorm the next big thing one moment and still tweak pixels right before launch. You have the ability to prioritise (you don't focus on illustrations if the UX looks like a love child between Frankenstein and Krusty the Clown). You work smart and are ready to improve processes. You have enough curiosity to stay savvy about industry and UX trends. You have confidence in your ideas and the ability to communicate them clearly. You follow through-when built, your designs actually look and work like they should. You monitor products after launch and are ready to suggest improvements. Bonus points You actively contribute to the UX community. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. You have personal pet projects you work on for fun in your free time. Your team and career You will be part of the DBS enterprise design team. The enterprise design team is redefining what great internal tools look like: working on a collaborative platform to enable bankers, credit risk managers and credit controllers to manage corporate loans digitally. Behind the scenes, the team understands how important it is for a proper design process and system to be in place before great things can happen. About DBS DBS is a leading financial services group in Asia. We are headquartered in Singapore, with a growing presence in Greater China, Southeast Asia and South Asia. We were named the Best Bank in the World by Global Finance in August 2018-the first Singapore and Asian bank to receive this honour. We want our customers to Live more, Bank less. And we want to make banking invisible. Every day, there's a lot more to explore, experience and enjoy-and a lot less time to do it in. That's why we've created banking that's fast, natural, effortless. Banking that's with you wherever life takes you, instead of taking you away from life. So you can enjoy a lot more life, with a lot less bank About the design team Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy. System Debug Engineer The Role: System Level Debug Engineering is a cost, quality, and time-to-market driven team responsible for enabling the availability of microprocessors to our customers. If you are looking for a fulfilling and challenging career as an engineer debugging PC system and IP level issues, you are at the right place! As a System Level Debug Engineer, you will perform debug analysis of AMD microprocessors at the system level leading to root cause determination, followed by corrective actions and recommending resolutions and implementation. This role requires interaction with design teams, Product & Test Engineering teams, Customer Quality teams, software & platform teams to come up with the best solution that balance quality and cost. You will experience working with and learning from AMD’s talented engineering teams around the world. The Person: We are looking for someone with a thirst of microprocessor technical knowledge, willing to learn and impart knowledge to others. One with the passion to work in depth on hardware and software encompassing the microprocessor to resolve issues. An independent and resourceful individual with strong technical, analytical and problem-solving skills. The applicant must have a basic understanding of x86 CPU architecture and functionality, as well as a broad understanding of various industry standard bus protocols, such as DDR, PCIe, USB, and Display. Key Responsibilities & Experience: Validation of failures and in-depth debug of customer returns. Root cause determination and recommendations for test coverage improvements and other quality enhancements. Conduct engineering evaluations and analysis to drive closure of production issues. Develop and apply new debug techniques to enhance technical depth in Product and Test Engineering. Is responsible for quality and timeliness of result for assigned tasks. Has accountability for accuracy, reliability and completeness of assignment results which contribute to a managed project’s success. Preferred experience: Familiar with general Computer Architecture such as X86 architecture, cache, PC computer organization and power management features. Has good understanding of post silicon electrical and mixed signal circuitries. Familiar with using voltmeters, oscilloscopes, logic analyzers and other debug tools. Good and effective presentation, written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work with geographically distributed product engineering teams. Able to deal with a high level of ambiguity. Experience with scripting languages such as Perl, Ruby, Python, shell script, or similar Proficiency in Windows, Unix, and Linux operating systems 2 years or more industry experience. Job Description As part of the Rider Lifecycle - Communication and Engagement team, you will be responsible for: Support the team to organize rider engagement events and activities Assist in the preparation of rider communications and engagement activities in accordance with the project / task requirements Working with cross functional departments to drive rider engagement activities Conceptualizing and operationalizing initiatives and campaigns for the Lifecycle Team Ad-hoc task relevant to the Lifecycle team’s requirements Requirements An interest in food is great here. It’s a place to unleash the foodie in you Excellent attention to detail, people skills and organisation skills Demonstrate experience using Microsoft Excel and related project/program management applications to drive best practice You must be a self-starter as we’ll look for you to manage your own time and priorities here Able to work in a team environment and has a keen interest to solve problems Able to commit for 6 months preferred After this internship, you will Have increased your organisational and communication skills Have gained knowledge in conceptualizing and implementing projects / campaigns Have gained knowledge about data-driven insights (and why this is so important to our business and our clients) Have gained knowledge about the Food and Delivery Industry in Singapore Know what it entails to work in a fast-paced scale-up with LOT’s of dynamic and daily challenges Why Deliveroo? When you first think about Deliveroo, you probably think of getting great food to your house. Awesome right? But behind the scenes is the real story. This story is one of high growth, huge challenges and an enormous opportunity ahead of us. We want to be the definitive food company - the app you go to any time you have a hunger pang. We are transforming the way people think about food. We’re a technology driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world, so come and join us for the ride. Diversity and Inclusion At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. We offer a wide range of competitive benefits in areas including health, family, finance, community, convenience, growth, time away and relocation. In 2018 we announced our decision to give every employee equity in the company. We did this because we wanted all of our employees, regardless of location, level or role to be owners and because we believe that this is the right thing to do. We believe this helps build a culture where everyone is committed and able to share in the company’s success. We believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest growing start-up’s around. Apply now to continue the conversation.

Job_Title: AVP, Senior Mobile and Web Developer, Technology & Operations | (WD30123)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. Proven experience as an app developer. Proficient in Swift. Extensive experience with iOS Frameworks such as Core Data and Core Animation. Experience with third party libraries such as FlexLayout, PinLayout, RxSwift, ReSwift. Experience with industry standard design patterns such as MVVM, Dependency Injection, Knowledge of iOS back-end services. Knowledge of Apple's design principals and application interface guidelines. Knowledge of analytic tracking tools including Adobe Analytics. Proficient in code versioning tools including Git. Proficient in dependency management tools including Carthage and SPM. Knowledge of C-based libraries. Familiarity with push notifications, APIs and cloud messaging. Experience with continuous integration including Jenkins and Groovy. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

What you do at AMD changes everything At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible.  We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Developing great technology takes more than talent: it takes amazing people who understand collaboration, respect, and who will go the “extra mile” to achieve unthinkable results.  It takes people who have the passion and desire to disrupt the status quo, push boundaries, deliver innovation, and change the world.   If you have this type of passion, we invite you to take a look at the opportunities available to come join our team. MTS Product Development Engineer (Test Engineer) The Role: Test Engineering is a cost, quality, and time-to-market driven team responsible for enabling the availability of AMD graphic products to our customers. Pre-silicon responsibilities for the Test Engineer include understanding product features, development of test plans and requirements, and developing software and hardware infrastructure to implement those plans. This requires interaction with Design and Platform Engineering and allows for the opportunity to provide test enhancement feedback for future designs. Post-silicon responsibilities include on time delivery of tests coverage and the execution of characterization plans. This may include debugging of silicon test performance issues, yield issues, manufacturing processes, and device marginalities. The Test Engineer will work closely with Design and Platform Engineering to root cause issues that result from the debug, characterization and margin analysis. The Person: Position involves test program development, characterization, data analysis, and silicon debug, preferably with experience in area of Test Program and characterization program generation, hardware DIB design requirements, and support of IP level tests bring up in leading edge process technologies. A proactive, outstanding teammate who focuses on teamwork, team building, and growing team success. AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology! Key Responsibilities: ATE Test patterns & test flows/method development, debug, test and characterization Experience skillsets of ATE testing: Scan, BIST, HSIO, DIB design, Test Program Owner etc Characterization and debug of new silicon designs and process technologies Optimization of test coverage and flows for increased quality, yield, cost improvement, and test time reduction Analysis of part failures leading to test coverage improvement Analysis of characterization data Preferred Experience: 5 years or more industry experience Good communication skills including data analysis and presentation Unix and Windows proficiency and C++, Java, Perl, Python scripting skills ATE Test handling/ execution and development experience - Advantest V93K experience preferred. Some IP knowledge, development and debug experience will be advantage Academic Credentials: BS/MS EE or equivalent Location: Singapore AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. AMD and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers and will consider all applicants without regard to race, marital status, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law. What you do at AMD changes everything At AMD, we push the boundaries of what is possible.  We believe in changing the world for the better by driving innovation in high-performance computing, graphics, and visualization technologies – building blocks for gaming, immersive platforms, and the data center. Product Development Engineer (SLT) The Role: You will be working with various team from Design, Firmware, BIOS, Diagnostics, Tools, Hardware, Quality, and validation teams to ensure End-to-End System Level Testing (SLT) solutions from NPI to Sustaining phase. You will be responsible in delivering optimized test strategy, which include test program development, system debug, data analysis, and evaluate and implement continuous improvements to drive best-in-class product. You will face challenges to come up with innovative and creative ways to solve the complex problems that come with developing products using the latest technologies. AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology! The Person: We’re looking for someone with an appetite for technical knowledge, motivated, resourceful, be independent, and can take initiative in this fast-paced environment. You should possess good communication skills and stakeholder management skills who can interface well with internal and external partners across AMD. Finally, you will be required to correlate and release high quality test programs for production testing while meeting key performance indicators for quality, yield, and test time. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with various engineering teams to determine System Level Test (SLT) coverage, content, characterization requirements, and root cause resolution for SLT device failures Early engagement in pre and post silicon phases, including test coverage bring-up, test flow integration, and test hardware qualification Develop test program infrastructure incorporating latest Best Known Methods Validate new product features, test conditions, test methodologies, and test contents Perform silicon characterization across process, voltage, and temperature Perform test program correlation and release for high volume production Drive Key Performance Indicators such as test time reduction, yield debug, and quality improvement across products Support qualification activities and customer return debug Preferred Experience: Knowledgeable in System Level Test or System Architecture of a PC Technical knowledge in OS kernel, driver, BIOS firmware Knowledge in HSIO standards such as PCIe, USB, JEDEC, DisplayPort, HDMI Demonstrated programming and scripting experience using various programming languages (Java, Ruby, Perl, Python, C, C++) Knowledgeable in version control tools (Git, SVN) Knowledgeable in statistical analysis Proficient in Windows, Unix, and Linux operating systems Fresh graduate will be considered for Product Engineer 1 position Academic Credentials: BS/MS Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or relevant field of studies Location: Singapore AMD does not accept unsolicited resumes from headhunters, recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services. Lendlease Singapore is currently searching for an IT Systems Engineer to be based in our mixed-use urban development at Paya Lebar. Lendlease is one of the world’s leading property and infrastructure groups. Our vision is to create the best places not just for our clients and communities, but especially for our employees. Delivering iconic and award-winning projects, we are setting standards in innovative and industry-leading project management, construction and design services locally and globally. As a IT Systems Engineer with the Lendlease business you will be required to carry out the Network infrastructure and software application routine maintenance, troubleshooting and diagnostic of the network to maintain its optimum performance at all time.  Your secondary role is to be the single point of contact for all associated building services and ICN systems whenever a fault happens. You must be a people person who have patience, people handling skill beside being a technical specialist.  Willingness to constant learning new skill is an advantage for this role. Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to; Manage and oversee the ICT and ELV system activities, and preparation of reports and plans to provide support to operational requirements, etc. Manage and oversee a pipeline of requests and manage team members to deliver services. Manage, oversee and lead the analysis of ICT/ELV/OBSI activities to identify and produce appropriate solutions and maintain quality standards. Oversee operational activity reports by collecting, analysing, and summarizing information and trends. Manage and oversee the updates to team schedules, presentations and documents. Manage and oversee OBSI/SBMS application vendor and assess their performance and quality standards to ensure adequate and qualified resource to support and provide continuity improvement on the existing application platform and management succession plans. May act as a liaison between the Company and technology vendors ensuring a thorough understanding of contractual relationships and maintaining appropriate maintenance agreements for technology solutions to ensure continued support for problem resolutions and enhancements. If you are looking for a dynamic role providing you a sense of purpose towards creating sustainable economic growth, vibrant and resilient communities and cities, and a healthy planet and people, this is the role for you. The Social Impact Manager role is focused on the regional oversight for delivery of social value partnerships, community grants and community day activities that will contribute towards Lendlease achieving our global social value target. Beyond the social value we create at the corporate level, this role will support the roll-out of social value metrics to projects and assets within the region. The role is crucial to supporting country-lead identification and delivery of our shared-value partnerships and initiatives across Asia. The Social Impact Manager, Asia role is a key member of the regional sustainability team and is responsible for managing, reporting on and growing key, shared value initiatives that form a part of our overall strategy towards creating social value in alignment with Lendlease’s Sustainability Framework and governance of the Lendlease Foundation. These social value efforts will extend to our projects and assets as Lendlease continues to grow and evolve the tracking, capturing and calculating of social value through the work we do as business as usual. This strategic role will provide opportunities for engagement across the Lendlease Asia Business and with Lendlease Regional counterparts and Group, sharing knowledge and best practice in how we achieve our target to create $250M of social value by 2025 and deliver on social value more broadly within the business. With a passion for driving social value, you will pioneer and build on a strong network of both internal and external strategic business relationships, garner Executive buy-in and support to co-create, collaborate, and jointly overcome potential challenges. A clear and persuasive communicator, you will be able to work cross functionally, as a strong connector who builds cooperative and collaborative relationships. A creative, innovative thinker with a strategic vision, you will be confident to take informed risks and experiment with approach. You will be able to handle multiple projects simultaneously, displaying calmness and composure in uncertain and ambiguous situations. Essential to the role is strong business management skills in non-profit sector and/or corporate foundations. You will be customer focussed with strong problem solving and organisational skills, complemented by excellent attention to detail. Your exceptional stakeholder management and influencing skills, with a global growth mindset will aid you in being extraordinary. Our Sustainability Framework, with its 12 pivotal elements, underpins our approach to Sustainability at an international and local level. This framework has long-term aspirations, with specific near-term goals for the three key elements of energy, water, and waste – where we want to lead performance. MTS Product Development Engineer (Test Engineer) The Role: Test Engineering is a cost, quality, and time-to-market driven team responsible for enabling the availability of microprocessors to our customers. Pre-silicon responsibilities for the Test Engineer include understanding product features, developing characterization test plans, highlighting test coverage holes, and developing software and hardware infrastructure to execute those plans. This requires interaction with Design and Platform Engineering and allows for the opportunity to provide test enhancement feedback for future designs. Post-silicon responsibilities include microprocessor debug & analysis and the execution of characterization plans. This may include silicon performance issues, yield issues, manufacturing processes, and device marginalities. The individual will work closely with Design and Platform Engineering to root cause issues that result from the debug, characterization and margin analysis. You will also provide datasheets specifications and drive improvements in yield. The Person: The individual must be familiar with test planning, test creation, characterization, data analysis, and Silicon debug of functional tests in leading edge process technologies. Applicant should be familiar with modern microprocessor architecture. Testing techniques, failure mechanisms, and debug processes are a plus. AMD's environment is fast paced, results oriented and built upon a legion of forward-thinking people with a passion for winning technology! Job_Title: Senior Associate/AVP, UX Researcher, Consumer Banking Group | (WD29433)
Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate/AVP, UX Researcher, Consumer Banking Group, Group Design - (WD29433) Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. About the design team Hi, we are the DBS user experience design team We create digital products that deserve to be built because they solve real problems in an impactful way with empathy. How we design We go beyond numbers Every dollar means something. No one actually wants money. We want what it can give us. So we acknowledge that money is not really about money. We inject emotion into our products to go from transactional to magical. We have one profound idea Because ambiguity is the enemy of good user experience. What is our unique value proposition? Would adding another feature dilute the idea or make it stronger? What you'll be doing You will keep us on our toes. Remind us to look away from the comfort of our screens and back at the reality—where our customers live. You will keep asking, 'Why are we doing this again?'. And not be satisfied with the answer, 'If we build it, they will come.' Here's what your week might look like Not everything has to be tested. You will identify when research is required and when best practices are the way to go. And you will help us communicate that to our stakeholders. You will do the groundwork: qualitative and quantitative research. We've done some interesting stuff: diary studies, ethnography, A/B testing, and others. In short, we love to experiment and hope you will join in. Once you've done the research, you'll create sharp and concise reports full of actionable findings. Your reports will be things of beauty that will inspire your colleagues to truly start seeing through the eyes of our customers. UX is a pretty established discipline here at DBS, but we can always use help to evangelise the importance of good UX Research, and how, just because it has the word 'research' in it, it doesn't take months! Here are the experience and skills we'd love you to have You have 2 to 5 years of relevant experience. You've had hands-on involvement with an end-to-end research process. You have a working knowledge of qualitative and quantitative data analyses, usability testing, eye tracking, card sorting, survey evaluation, A/B and multivariate testing and heuristic evaluations. You can filter out noise to uncover actionable insights. In our experience, people who are organised, methodical and analytical are very good at this. You are an eloquent public speaker and an accomplished report-writer. You are an empathic human being with interest in psychology, anthropology, human-computer interaction, cognitive science and business. Bonus points You have experience in the fintech industry. You've been a designer yourself (or have some design experience). We find that it really helps when working with designers. You are a 'best practice junkie' and have a treasure trove of usability research around the best design pattern to use. You're kind of a behavioural science geek. Your team and career You will report to a Consumer Banking Group research lead and will collaborate across the entire Research & Insights team to achieve team goals. You will own an area of user research for CBG. Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: Regional Workplace Health & Safety Manager, APAC
Job_Descriptions: VN7241 Regional Workplace Health & Safety Manager, APAC Full Time Permanent Real Estate and Facilities Singapore About AVEVA AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software, driving digital transformation and sustainability. By connecting the power of information and artificial intelligence with human insight, AVEVA enables teams to use their data to unlock new value. We call this Performance Intelligence. AVEVA’s comprehensive portfolio enables more than 20,000 industrial enterprises to engineer smarter, operate better and drive sustainable efficiency. AVEVA supports customers through a trusted ecosystem that includes 5,500 partners and 5,700 certified developers around the world. The company is headquartered in Cambridge, UK, with over 6,500 employees and 90 offices in over 40 countries. Learn more at www.aveva.com. We take pride in our core values and the diversity of our people, valuing the unique experience and expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. At AVEVA, we’re all about Limitless possibilities. Are you? Job Purpose: To develop and implement the strategy for workplace health & safety across the APAC region. Provide advice and guidance to the Workplace Experience Team and senior leaders on health & safety matters. Principle Accountabilities: • Lead and manage the regional Workplace Health & Safety Team. • Expected to take a regional lead on health & safety projects and initiatives providing expert advice and guidance to colleagues and AVEVA leadership locally and regionally and providing coordinated advice globally in conjunction with other members of the Workplace Experience Team. • Engage across the region with the Workplace Experience Team, HR, IT, Location Leads etc to drive a positive safety culture. • Support with emergency planning and take a lead in responding to emergenices • Continually review internal policies and procedures to ensure they are up to date with the lates regulatory requirements relevant to the region and countries therein. • Lead and guide the team in the investigation of all Workplace Health & Safety (WHS) incidents or accidents and ensure the required reords are completed and stored. Ensure lessons learned are captured, communicated and HSE system updated as required. • Prepare and chair WHS Committee Meetings in line with requirements and/or attend Works Council Meetings or similar. • Work with the Global Travel Team, Business Continuity Manager and Physical Security Team to assess and manage travel related risk. • Prepare and deliver internal and third-party audit requirements. Provide data for external tenders and bids. • Manage third party/supplier relationships. • Working with global colleagues across Real Estate & Workplace Experience and specifically other Regional Workplace Health & Safety Managers design and implement a coordinated global WHS training programme including the development of a WHS induction to ensure AVEVA provides a safe place to work for colleagues and visitors. • Coordinate local and as needed regional workplace health and safety training and awareness courses and information for colleagues – including fire warden, first aid training and rota management • Communicate with regulatory offices as required and ensure all AVEVA locations are complient with local requirements. • Contininly looking for improvements to AVEVA’s WHS offering. • Act as the competent person for the region. • Carries out site inspections, risk assessments, accident investigation, hazard identification and as needed provides escalation route for major incidents or concerns • Works with Regional Head of Workplace Experience and other department/function leadership to identify, manage and reduce and workplace related risks and hazards • Support Occupational Health provision working closely with HR colleagues ensuring all health surveillance requirements are met • Develop, in conjunction with other Regional Workplace Health & Safety Managers and other members of the Real Estate & Workplce Experience team, effective tools, process and policies to manage AVEVA’s duty of care for colleagues working from home – either as remote based employees or under Dynamic Work programme • Work with colleagues in People Team (HR and Employee Communications) to collate data and reporting as needed in relation to AVEVA workplace health and safety metrics and data reporting in compliance with OSHA or other (e.g., Schneider Electric) reporting requirements Essential Competencies, Knowledge, Skills and Experience: Looking for minimum 7+ years of work experience from relevant industry • Proven experience in large global organisation • Proven leadership and management experience within a matrix, multi-site role able to communication and engage with a wide range of stakeholders • Strong technical knowledge • NEBOSH, NCRQ Diploma or an equivalent with membership of IOSH or other relevant professional body • Self-motivating and able to work as part of a team • Ability to manage and deliver tasks relating to multiple sites • Good knowledge of basic PC skills – email, Microsoft Office - Word, Excel, PowerPoint • Strong oral and written communication skills • Good administrational and reporting skills • Able to interpret health & safety legislation, policy and best practice and implement as needed within AVEVA • Excellent Customer Relationship management skills • Able to lead a virtual team and obtain support from Workplace Managers to use site resources. • Knowledge of dealing with ergonomics and workplace health and safety • Regional workplace health and safety knowledge and experience across multiple countries Behaviours: • Flexible to deal with any situation • Excellent organisational skills • Confidentiality and discretion Key Working Relationships: • Workplace Experience Colleagues • Location leads • People Team, and other AVEVA function • Third parties eg OSHA, HSE, suppliers etc AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplar employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business. Diagnostics Development Engineer THE ROLE: The diagnostics team is responsible for developing test suites that exercise and validate the hardware blocks in the Graphics and CPU chips developed at AMD. We are heavily involved in diagnostics development for the latest innovations that power the ultimate visual and computing experience.
