Job_Title: SVP, Culture and Wellbeing, Group Human Resources - (WD31811)
Job_Descriptions: About Group Human Resources At DBS, we create a supportive environment where employees can Live fulfilled - Be the Best, Be the Change and Be the Difference. In HR, we empower our people to be the best that they can be. We are critical thinkers, objective yet empathetic communicators, with a keen analytical mind. At its very core, we care, and we want our people to know that they are deeply valued. You will thrive as a trusted HR advisor to our businesses, as you strive to attract and select the right people for the right role; to provide a rewarding and supportive environment; to build the capabilities of our people to be future-ready; and to change the culture to be more entrepreneurial. As a part of our HR team, you will also have the unique opportunity to discover how we enrich the lives of 32,000 people and gain hands-on experience in our comprehensive range of HR functions. Join us as we embark on our HR New Horizon III to: -    Shape the Future of Work, Workforce, Workplace -    Shape HR through Digital, Data and Horizontal Organisation -    Shape Employee Experiences -    Shape Culture by Design About Culture and Wellbeing We are purpose-driven - what we do propels DBS towards being the Best Bank for a Better World. You will play an essential role in driving organisational health and employee wellbeing through innovative programmes and practices to shape DBS' culture and empower employees to be the Best, Be the Change and Be the Difference to realise DBS' ambitions. We enable the organisation and employees to develop high performing teams and a future-ready workforce to drive the business strategies and bring about impactful customer outcomes. Key Accountabilities We are looking for individuals with strong track record of driving transformation at the organisation-level through people and culture. You have to be bold to try new ideas, have strategic and analytical thinking as we continuously sharpen our culture, future of work and wellbeing practices and interventions by integrating best practices / trends, leveraging on emerging HR technology and data-driven insights. We leverage Digital, Data and Science widely to deliver innovative programmes and levers to create the right culture, future-ready workforce and high-performing teams and yet we don't lose sight of our employee wellbeing: Shape culture to drive organisation and workforce health -    Development of impactful levers and interventions to enable our leaders, managers and employees to demonstrate the desired behaviours -    Alignment of all new/ existing people practices to embed our culture -    Continuous deep diagnosis of the state of DBS culture Drive effective hybrid work -    Adapting our people practices to drive more transparency, empowerment and flexibility -    Embedding the culture, best practices and rituals -    Equipping managers and employees to co-create effective flexible work experiences (principles, tools, resources, training) Drive and manage employee wellbeing in a holistic manner to build a resilient workforce: -    Development of wellbeing strategy, approach and interventions -    Structured approach to diagnose, measure and monitor -    Empowering employees to take charge (e.g. education, tools, adoption of flexible work arrangement, etc..) and building managers capabilities and competencies Transforming the way we work -    Partnering the business and HR stakeholders to drive and operationalise the Horizontal Organisation to maximise end to end customer outcomes. This includes alignment of key people practices to formalise collaboration and joint accountability Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Program Management Officer (IT) Overview: The PMO will be in charge of assisting our Technical Project Managers (TPM) in organizing our ongoing technology infrastructure projects. This task involves monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner. PMO handle tasks for our TPMs with the goal of seeing them through on time and within budget. PMO's roles are crucial to a company's success because they ensure projects run smoothly by controlling workflow, scheduling assignments, evaluating the course of the project and reporting its status to the management and stakeholders. Types of project delivery includes various components of infrastructure service solutions / delivery including network connectivity, midrange server build, virtual server build, storage, and performance / capacity planning. Responsibilities: • Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets and expenditures. • Organizing, attending and participating in stakeholder meetings. • Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings. • Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings. • Ensuring project deadlines are met. • Determining project changes. • Providing administrative support as needed. • Undertaking project tasks as required. • Developing project strategies. • Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project. • Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable. • Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution. • Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members. • Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective. Key Requirements: • Excellent organizational and communication skills • Detail oriented • Experience in infrastructure project management or project management. • Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook. • Knowledge file management, transcription, and other administrative proceduress. • Ability to work on tight deadlines. Job_Title: AVP/Senior Associate, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad API & Data Integration, Merchants, Consumer Banking Group
Job_Descriptions: AVP/Senior Associate, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad API & Data Integration, Merchants, Consumer Banking Group Business Function DBS is a leading Asia bank servicing our clients for over 50 years in the 18 markets we operate in. Besides providing a comprehensive suite of financial solutions, our award-winning digital solutions are targeted at our clients as people are the heart of everything, we do in DBS. We are committed to deliver banking that is simple and hassle free and embed our digital solutions in client's everyday life as we expand on our ecosystem's partnership. Job Purpose In our team at One Rewards, we collaborate with our key stakeholders in technology and business (product) to deliver a Rewards solution that rewards customers for all interactions with the bank. These interactions allow customer to earn and redeem DBS points through acquisition and usage of DBS products and services across various touchpoints within the DBS product ecosystem and well as partner programmes. One of the key responsibilities of this job function will be to provide expertise and detailed knowledge acquired from both technology and business stakeholders to build and groom user stories, ensure end to end execution of the user acceptance testing using both manual and automation tools and provide quality and timely output before release to market. The delivery of these highly complex and sophisticated reward solutions requires a capable and highly motivated individual who excel in stakeholder engagements and familiar with project management to deliver successful outcomes for the organisation with in-depth consideration to the customer journey experience. You will be required to collaborate widely with the various applications technical team supporting our delivery as well as our business counterparts on update. Welding and Materials Engineer Do you have passion for welding engineering? Do you enjoy delivering successful projects for customers? Join our Team Bringing cutting-edge physical and digital technologies together to create oilfield equipment is the beating heart of our work. Devising smarter systems that control and monitor oil and gas extraction, our subsea wellhead systems and casing connectors are industry leading. Our team provides equipment and support for customer operations to ensure continuity for production. Partner with the best The Welding and Materials Engineer will form an integral part of the Global Materials and Process Engineering (MPE) department, working within the Offshore product line Centre of Excellence (based in Singapore). The Lead Engineer is required to take full ownership of all associated activities with the role outlined below, and in doing so secure best in class delivery. As the Welding and Materials Engineer, you will be responsible for: Providing guidance, mentoring and support on topics associated with Welding and Fabrication processes within the local business unit and the wider engineering community. Developing and updating engineering guidelines, specifications and best practices within welding and fabrication processes, and providing support in aligning such processes within the Global Subsea Production Systems, Services and Offshore (SPSS&O) MPE team Acting as a Lead Engineer as appropriate on assignments to support FEEDs, tenders, EPC projects, and purchase orders, and execute all Materials and Process Engineering tasks with efficiency and integrity. Tasks include but are not limited to; Review and perform technical evaluations of contract requirements, design codes, manufacturing standards and specifications, Customer contact – writing technical clarifications/exceptions and attending meetings on materials selection and manufacturing, Definition of Baker Hughes/Contract requirements - writing of technical reports and specifications, Provide materials selection and fabrication advice during design phase, Support to supply chain, attendance at audits and pre-production meetings, Review of vendors’ special process procedures, such as e.g. manufacturing and welding procedure specifications, for use in the manufacturing of subsea equipment, Review and disposition of concessions and deviations. Potential to act as EPC/System project Materials Engineering lead when called upon. Ensure compliance initiatives are implemented and training requirements are met. Fuel your passion To be successful in this role you will have: Minimum of Bachelors’ Degree in Welding Engineering or Materials Engineering from an accredited college or university with at least 5 years of significant work experience within Welding Engineering (ideally with a focus on subsea equipment). International Welding Engineer (IWE) status (preferred) Significant experience and/or certification in NDE preferred (RT/UT/PT/MT) Good understanding of allied material manufacturing and fabrication processes Familiarity with relevant industry standards (NORSOK, ISO, ASME, API, ASTM, DNVGL etc.) as well as design and fabrication requirements for subsea products. Willingness and ability to travel, as required Strong oral and written communication skills Strong interpersonal and leadership skills Strong analytical and problem-solving skills Ability to cooperate and interface effectively with all levels of a matrix environment Strong customer mind-set Flexible, proactive and results oriented Self-motivation and be able to work independently and in teams Work in a way that works for you We recognize that everyone is different and that the way in which people want to work and deliver at their best is different for everyone too. In this role, we can offer the following flexible working patterns: Working flexible hours - flexing the times when you work in the day to help you fit everything in and work when you are the most productive Working with us Our people are at the heart of what we do at Baker Hughes. We know we are better when all of our people are developed, engaged and able to bring their whole authentic selves to work. We invest in the health and well-being of our workforce, train and reward talent, and develop leaders at all levels to bring out the best in each other. About Us With operations in over 120 countries, we provide better solutions for our customers and richer opportunities for our people. As a leading partner to the energy industry, we're committed to achieving net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 and we're always looking for the right people to help us get there. People who are as passionate as we are about making energy safer, cleaner and more efficient. Join Us Are you seeking an opportunity to make a real difference in a company with a global reach and exciting services and clients? Come join us and grow with a team of people who will energize and inspire you!

Corporate Culture and Guiding Principles: Tullett Prebon, part of TP ICAP group, operates at the heart of the world’s financial, energy and commodities markets. We are professional intermediaries playing a pivotal role in the world’s financial markets,covering FX, Rates, Credit, Equities, Energy & Commodities. Globally, we are a leading provider of services to market participants, with execution via a range of regulated venues, covering a full spectrum of over-the-counter (OTC) asset classes. Matching buyers and sellers, we facilitate the development of liquidity and price discovery in these markets and provide insight and context to our clients. We operate a hybrid model where brokers provide business-critical intelligence to clients. It’s supplemented by proprietary screens for historical data, analytics and execution functionality. Our clients include banks, insurance companies,pension and hedge funds, asset managers, energy producers and refiners, as well as risk and compliance managers and charities. We are known in the market for our Honesty , Integrity , and Excellence in the provision of service to our clients. Above all else, we Respect our clients and each other, without bias. Employees are expected to uphold the values and principles of our cultural framework in performance of their job duties. Responsibilities: Promote Tullett Prebon as a company Maintain and develop existing client relationships and make contact with prospective new clients where appropriate Maintain an up to date knowledge of the products and markets in which you work; actively solicit feedback from industry participants through various means, including trade calls, surveys, industry events, trade shows and conferences Understand the desk’s business strategy and seek to identify new business opportunities relating to trends, future markets, products and clients On-board new clients following the correct process with the Client On-Boarding team Assess client needs and financial conditions to identify internal cross selling opportunities Understand pertinent regulation within the evolving regulatory landscape Support a risk and compliance aware culture and comply with group policies Exercise independent judgement and act with integrity, care, skill and diligence to avoid conflicts of interest and escalate issues as appropriate Risk Related Responsibilities: * Ensure that you understand the risks and controls on your desk; what could go wrong, what controls you have to prevent/detect orcontain these. Ensure that you are fully aware of and adhere to internal policies that relate to your role or any other activities for which you have any level of responsibility Report any breaches of policy to Compliance and/or your supervisor as described in the policy Escalate risk events immediately and log them within 24 hours using the risk event capture form on the intranet Provide input if requested to the Risk and Control Self-Assessment process, scenario analysis ‘Deep Dive’ reviews and any other risk management processes as required Report all loss events, or near misses that could have resulted in a loss, in excess of the reporting threshold Observe proper standards of market conduct and ensure you are aware of,understand and comply with all regulatory, exchange or clearing house requirements applicable to your role Complete any mandatory training by the required deadlines Ensure that you adhere to the terms of any applicable Desk Manual Required Registrations: To ensure the Group complies with its regulatory requirements, all employees performing regulatory or client facing roles need to be appropriately registered and authorised prior to dealing with or for its clients. Employees are responsible for assessing, in conjunction with their Line Manager and Compliance, whether they require authorisation by any supervisory body to perform a particular role. Prior to reviewing and confirming whether you are or require to be an approved person, please liaise with your Line Manager or speak with the Compliance Team. Person Specification: Client Focused Personable and engaging Communicates effectively and efficiently to internal and external stakeholders Build relationships and networks with both internally and externally wherever possible Demonstrates strong customer focus Demonstrate ability to work effectively with others Constructively handles disagreements to reach a resolution Ability to work with diverse groups/personalities Innovative Open to innovative ideas/experiences and ability to create new ideas, approaches or insights Seeks opportunities for improvements Handles situations and problems with innovation and creativity Dynamic & Competitive Demonstrates high levels of energy inseeking out and achieving new goals Goes that “extra mile” Is a self-starter Shows evidence of being comfortable working in fast paced or pressured environments Enjoys a challenge and is able to escalate Does not give up easily Open & Communicative Adapts communication style to suit audience Projects personal credibility Interacts confidently without being overbearing Ability to work effectively in a high pressure environment Keeps emotions under control in difficult situations Handles criticism constructively Professional Integrity Able to demonstrate honesty, integrity and professionalism Promotes loyalty to TP ICAP and its principles Works ethically and shows respect for both professional and company values Effective Excellent attention to detail, highly organised with a proactive approach Strong analytical ability and problem solving skills Knowledge & Understanding Understands ideas and has a viewpoint on the markets and economy Willingness to engage with internal and external stakeholders outside of the immediate desk environment Prior experience in Energy & Commodities markets Chinese language proficiency required to manage clientele Existing client base would be an advantage but not necessary

Job_Title: Business Analyst (Banking-SuccessFactors, Reporting, Business Intelligence) 6 months Fixed -Term Contract, Singapore  (Singapore PR / Singaporean)
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Amirah Reza Anwar Recruiter View profile & contact You’ll be working for a banking company who is looking for a Business Analyst. This will be a 6-months fixed -term contract role to be based in Singapore. Key responsibilities Understand the main business drivers for success; Acquire knowledge of the business and regional footprints; Awareness of the functional roles within HR, their interaction and involvement in the high-level business processes. Understand and ensure alignment to the WMA service Model aligned to the wider HR Target Operating Model. Manage complex business reporting requirements from gathering to refinement to realisation; looking for opportunities to standardise and simplify by critically prioritising between regulatory and legal requirements against business processes. Documentation of detailed requirements based on technical build and business user standard operating procedures. Understanding and challenging design based on the business case benefits of solutions via reporting or via the core tool – managing change requests through structured programme governance. Set the standards for all projects to follow, user story creation, impact assessment etc. through business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, task and workflow analysis. Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high level information into details, abstract up from low level information to a general understanding and distinguish user requests from the underlying true business needs. Proactively communicate and collaborate with business stakeholders and IT teams to analyse information needs and functional requirements and deliver the Functional and Non-Functional requirements in the stories. Lead or contribute to underlying business process discovery, analysis, reengineering and documentation. Matching process design with business goals, user stories/experience and functional capability. Drive and challenge business units on their assumptions of how they will successfully execute their plan. Guide the product owner in creating user stories and acceptance criteria, in a clear and unambiguous style. Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously. Excellent verbal and written communication skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into functional and non-functional requirements. Serve as a conduit between the customer community (Key Stakeholders and end-users) and the software development team through which requirements flow; Ensure developers understand the context of the changes and impact to any downstream and upstream systems. Collaborate with developers and subject matter experts to establish the technical vision and analyse trade-offs between usability and performance needs; Understand system technical limitations at a high level. Highlight risks to the PM before they become issues so they can be tracked Review SIT defects prior to the start of UAT in conjunction with Scrum Delivery Manager. Involvement in UAT test phase; helping with or even leading on test strategy creation, guiding users and supporting /analysing user queries. What you'll need to succeed Good analytical, organization and stakeholder management skills. Good working experience in Business Intelligence and supporting UAT Testing. Experience in leading business process discovery, and analysis . Excellent communication skills, approachable and good at forming relationships with people of all levels within the business. Good working experience in Human Resources Consulting and HR Management is a plus. This role is only open to Singapore PR and Singaporean. The max salary range is 10K SGD – 13K SGD per month. Johnson & Johnson is recruiting for an HR Leader, Strategic Partnership Group preferably located in Singapore or the Philippines. We embrace research and science -- bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people. That’s why for more than 130 years, we have aimed to keep people well at every age and every stage of life. Today, as the world’s largest and most broadly-based healthcare company, we are committed to using our reach and size for good. We strive to improve access and affordability, create healthier communities, and put a healthy mind, body and environment within reach of everyone, everywhere. Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. Joining a flexible team of HR leaders across Asia Pacific, this role is responsible for providing strategic support and solutions towards critical global, regional, and local business priorities. As an internal HR consultant, this role will partner HR as well as business leaders, to provide HR leadership and subject matter expertise, such as in the areas of Coaching, Talent Management, Organizational Design, Transformation, Change Management, and Business Partnering. This role will develop HR strategy and related HR approaches for the client groups to drive high business value, engagement and productivity. This will require innovative and strategic thinking and a willingness / initiative to try new approaches. A minimum of 8 years of professional experience is required A minimum of 5 years of progressive HR experience is required People leadership experience preferred Leadership Imperatives Credo & Our Purpose: demonstrate and role model Credo behaviors Connect: collaborate extensively with diverse teams to integrate HR solutions, balancing voice of local customer, external trends, short- and long term needs to achieve business goals Shape: identify creative and innovative ideas; challenge the status quo Grow: effectively lead, develop, and accelerate others; role model exceptional people leadership HR competencies Prioritized competencies Integrator: look across groups and needs to identify/build end-to-end, holistic solutions; role model enterprise mindset Strategy leader: Create, shape, and apply meaningful strategies that meet long- and short-term goals Operational excellence: Continuously drive enhanced effectiveness and efficiency of HR solutions Technical expertise: Consult in prioritized areas for the region, e.g. A&D, Transformation, Change Management, OD, Data Science/Analytics Other important competencies Trusted partner: effectively coach, influence, and advise Change advocate: drive strategic change to proactively meet evolving business needs and explore new business models Talent mindset: develop high performing, diverse, sustainable talent pools; expertise in talent management Business mindset: integrate internal and external business drivers and financial insights to drive talent outcomes for the business Analytics mindset: identify and use data to inform decision making Digital champion: identify, use, and role model the use of technology to meet needs

Position Summary Under the supervision of the Head of Internal Audit Hub Asia-Pacific, the Auditor: Performs APAC-wide independent, objective assurance and consulting activities in order to add value and improve the organisation’s operations Monitors the compliance of the risk management system and continuous improvement of the systems in place. In particular this means: Identifying and assessing fundamental economic risks within the area of responsibility ensuring the sustainable commercial success of the business. Monitoring the reliability and effectiveness of management and other controls in the area of responsibility Providing independent, pragmatic advice and defining adequate preventative and protective measures Continuous monitoring of the efficiency of all business processes and procedures Monitoring of Global Business Controls in consultation with the Head of Audit Hub Asia-Pacific Evaluation of savings potentials and definition of action plans to achieve the defined objectives Monitoring the implementation of the submitted proposals and recommended actions Job Responsibilities: Participating in the coordination of audit contents, objective and schedule in order to ensure an efficient accomplishment of the audit, together with the department(s) audited. Gathering, analyzing and evaluating audit relevant data prior to the start of the audit in order to improve the result and the quality of the audit under the professional guidance of the audit manager. Supporting the senior / project manager conducting the introductory meeting in order to ensure a common understanding of the objectives and proceedings of the audit as well as a good cooperation with all parties concerned in the audited unit. Analysis and evaluation of processes of particular, individually audited topics within the scope of the audit conducted, at the same time development of proposals for process improvements and risk minimization, under the guidance of the senior / project manager. Supporting the senior / project manager in the preparation of information to the responsible process owners and the management of the audited unit about the audit results after the completion of the audit in order to ensure that the audit results are implemented immediately or in the near future, and to ensure a climate of cooperative team-work with the audited unit. Preparation of the final audit report in respect of individually audited topics in cooperation with the senior / project manager, in order to inform the board and other members of the management of the business segment and the audited division, as well as to ensure the implementation of all audit results after the final consultation regarding the content with the responsible representatives of the audited unit. Participating in the control of the implementation of all audit results in order to ensure the improvement of the profitability of the unit audited; In case of problems, with the support of the line manager. In case of individually conducted audit topics, calculation and assessment of evaluation approaches and bookkeeping-records in order to ensure generally accepted accounting standards within the year-end reporting of Linde plc and the timely detection of negative/unfavourable developments within individual business units, under the guidance of the senior / project manager and in coordination with the line manager. Required Qualifications/Experience Educational Requirements / Experience § University degree in business administration or a related field (a higher degree is an asset) § At least 3 years postgraduate experience § Due to the international shape of the Linde plc the Auditor must be multilingual (at least English and Chinese; Korean will be seen as an asset) Technical Skills § Basic knowledge of the accounting principles as defined in US GAAP/IFRS § Knowledge of the principles, procedures, and techniques of accounting and of financial records and transactions. § Understanding of the principles and application of good corporate governance, Internal Control system, business and operational risk and control processes and procedures. SOX experience is appreciated. § Knowledge of other regulations affecting businesses Auditing Skills § Under supervision: able to support special audits or investigations including due‑diligence work, post‑acquisition reviews and fraud investigations.. § Ability to gain the confidence and respect of management and staff through attributes such as professionalism and positive attitude. § Ability to gather, analyse, and evaluate facts, and prepare and present concise oral and written reports. § Knowledge of International Auditing Standards IT Skills § Experienced in use of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint § Experienced in use of process mining tool (e.g. Celonis) and data mining tool (e.g. IDEA) Editorial/Reporting/Presentation Skills § Ability to maintain, and update Company audit relevant standards, guidelines, procedures, checklists, and dedicated programs § Able to write complete, concise, logical, well laid‑out reports and presentations § Competent to give confident oral presentations to management or colleagues Competence § Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both orally and in writing. § Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships throughout the organisation

At Franklin Templeton, everything we do is focused on one thing – delivering better client outcomes. We do that by partnering closely with our clients, assessing their strategic needs, and identifying the solution or solutions that can meet the challenge. Over 12,000 employees working in 34 countries around the world are dedicated to servicing investment solutions for our clients in more than 160 countries. For more than 70 years our success has been a direct result of the talent, skills and persistence of our people, and we are looking for qualified candidates to join our team. We are looking for a Client Services Executive (6 Month Contract) to join the team in Singapore. This role is responsible for KYC due diligence for both corporate and retail clients to meet regulatory requirements. This role also helps to protect the best interests of the funds, shareholders and FTI by providing support to Global Shareholder Services strategies and system enhancements and adhering to policies and procedures and workflow processes. What are the ongoing responsibilities of this position? Performs ongoing KYC due diligence for both corporate and retail clients to meet regulatory requirements Supports initial clients reach out (data file review, letter creation, making phone calls to clients) Monitors and tracks client follow ups Supports client communications Supports initial review of returning information from clients Administration Answers routine customer inquiries, articulates customer concerns/problems and contributes to solutions within scope of work via inbound and outbound calls Identifies customers’ current and future needs proactively to ensure a positive customer experience Verifies customer requests to ensure information is correct and in good order, and takes appropriate action Corresponds with customers via phone, email or standard/complex written correspondence, where appropriate Adheres to all policies & procedure guidelines and customer service standards to achieve operational, productivity and quality objectives Performs activities related to department’s mailing and releases client documentation via web portal May perform relevant operational or service ad-hoc requests assigned by leader What qualifications, skills and experience would help someone to be successful? Bachelor's Degree 1 to 2 years of prior working experience in a financial service firm Strong PC knowledge including use of Microsoft Office applications Excellent written and verbal communication skills to interact with clients, business partners and management Build and maintain good relationship with clients and business partners Prior client service experience preferred Detailed oriented and good analytical skills to identify potential issues Effective organizational skills, ability to multitask and prioritize own workload Ability to work independently and in a team to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams Ability to resolve queries arising in daily work, maintaining accountability and escalating issues appropriately Ability to start within short notice is highly preferred What makes Franklin Templeton unique? In addition to the dynamic and professional environment at Franklin Templeton, we strive to ensure that our employees have access to a competitive and valuable set of Total Rewards—the mix of both monetary and non-monetary rewards provided to you in recognition for your time, talents, efforts, and results. We believe that being a good corporate citizen is good business. To us, corporate citizenship means being accountable, serving our clients, being an employer of choice, managing our environmental impact, and supporting our communities. An emphasis on corporate citizenship is embedded in our culture and values, and is an important element of how we achieve success. We are also committed to your learning and development with resources focused around Experience, Exposure, and Education, to help you achieve your professional development goals. Take some time to, meet some of our people, and see what it means to say, “I AM Franklin Templeton.” Franklin Templeton Investments values diversity in its workforce and welcomes employees from different backgrounds, generations, capabilities, cultural identification, sexual orientations, and gender expression, in addition to other attributes that contribute to a truly diverse and inclusive community. We regret that only short-listed candidates will be notified.

The team has end-to-end ownership of ad data's lifecycle including data ETL, data warehouse and data services. We leverage data technologies to advice local customer support teams and help global advertisers make wiser investment decisions on our Advertising Platform. Therefore, we are tasked with innovating on daily basis to create and maintain complex systems at large scale and continue expanding the capacity to better serve advertisers growing at exponential pace. You will be a part of a team of top notch technical professionals developing scalable systems and with a focus on sustained operational excellence. Members of this team will be challenged to innovate using cutting edge technologies. Qualifications - Final year or recent graduate with a background in Computer Science or other related fields; - Fluency in at least one programming language such as Java/Scala/C/C++/Python; - Working experience of distributed storage engines (Elasticsearch/Druid/ClickHouse/Doris) or computational frameworks (Hadoop/Spark/Flink/Hive/Presto); - Passionate about building reliable infrastructure and good communication skills; - Understanding of ads technology/product is a plus but not required. Job_Title: VP, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad Rewards Accrual | (WD30342)
Job_Descriptions: VP, One Rewards : Product Owner - Squad Rewards Accrual, Redemption & Campaign, Consumer Banking Group - (WD30342) Business Function As the leading bank in Asia, DBS Consumer Banking Group is in a unique position to help our customers realise their dreams and ambitions. As a market leader in the consumer banking business, DBS has a full spectrum of products and services, including deposits, investments, insurance, mortgages, credit cards and personal loans, to help our customers realise their dreams and aspirations at every life stage. Our financial solutions are not only the best in the business – they were made just right for you. Job Purpose In our team at One Rewards, we collaborate with our key stakeholders in technology and business (product) to deliver a Rewards solution that rewards customers for all interactions with the bank. These interactions allow customer to earn and redeem DBS points through acquisition and usage of DBS products and services across various touchpoints within the DBS product ecosystem and well as partner programmes. One of the key responsibilities of this job function will be to provide expertise and detailed knowledge acquired from both technology and business stakeholders to build and groom user stories, ensure end to end execution of the user acceptance testing using both manual and automation tools and provide quality and timely output before release to market. The delivery of these highly complex and sophisticated reward solutions requires a capable and highly motivated individual who excel in stakeholder engagements and familiar with project management to deliver successful outcomes for the organisation with in-depth consideration to the customer journey experience. You will be required to collaborate widely with the various applications technical team supporting our delivery as well as our business counterparts on update. As the bank continue to grow and invest in digital platform and increasing our digital suite of services, testing scope have expanded, platform have become more complex thus there need to have more creative and sustainable way of ensuring that our services delivered, both old and new remain robust and make banking invisible and joyful to our customers. Responsibilities Team Lead for One Rewards Product Owners. Strategize from a bank wide approach, across CBG and IBG to create synergy across feature requirements from different business units and manage earn and redemption interactions consolidated at a customer level. To manage Squad under Rewards Accrual, Redemption & Campaign covering features including but not limited to: Rewards Accruals Ability to reward customer based on transaction parameters, product holding, customer profile For particular action, e.g. filling of profile, completion of activity/task, purchase of product, enrolment into programme, referral Rewards Redemption Across DBS platforms, for DBS product and services, to offset fee and charges, at merchant partners (website/apps) for products and services or donations; instantly/through digital vouchers, or set aside for wish-listed items Campaign Management To be able to view rewards dashboard across DBS platforms – Paylah!/Digibank/iWealth/Internet Banking including campaign registration & progress, rewards history Personalisation of campaign targeting based on customer segmentation/tenure/product holding for award tiering, quantum (value), validity Creation of digital, automated journey of campaigns end-to-end from targeting/engagement, to sign-up/apply (straight through processing), and fulfilment including communication in the form of on reminders, status updates, fulfilment/rewards crediting; retargeting for next campaign/action A detail understanding of the current business systems with a view on connectivity to new system builds and the downstream influence on GL, Customer Journeys and Communication is key. The ability to take into account current process requirements and consider improvements to workflows presented, potential system migration, API connectivity between merchant partners regarding rewarding, redemption and voucher management is necessary. You will also be expected to manage a team of Product Owners, ensuring efficiency and effective delivery of features and requirements in addition to Rewards Accrual, Redemption & Campaign and including Customer Profile & Servicing, API & Data Integration, Merchant Onboarding and Loyalty Management, Gamification and Engagement. Work closely with country business stakeholders, channel and product teams. Lead and be responsible for writing and developing Business Requirement Document (BRD) / User Stories. Work closely with design team to conceptualize and optimize customer journey. Review the technical Functional Specifications Document (FSD)/Narratives/ User Stories with technology counterparts to ensure that these specifications are designed in accordance to business requirements. Incorporating feature request into product roadmap, grooming and proritising backlog. Scheduling releases and coordinating Sprints Follow progress of work and address production issues during sprints Supervising a team of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) testers. Delivery lead should ensure that UAT test plans and test cases / automation are executed within the stipulated UAT schedule. Support post-implementation tasks such user training to touch-points, production problem investigation, escalation, and resolution Self-starter with strong business acumen, independent and able to rise to challenges and meet deadlines effectively Ensure customer issues are resolved within the SLA and prompt follow-up to ensure closure in issues To manage between system capability and business needs and balance the timelines and deliverables. Requirements Degree holder with relevant experience, preferably in Consumer Banking, Payments and/or mobile/Internet Banking with strong business acumen is an advantage. Strong IT background preferably with experience in implementing system projects. Has minimal 8 - 10 years of experience in business analysis, requirements gathering and scripting; and close interaction with business users Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with a positive working attitude. Ability to work and cope under pressure with accuracy and commitment, manage complex environment such as testing and closure of issues. A good team player who can work well with product specialist, operational teams and technical teams Extremely meticulous and systematic with an eye for detail Possess the ability to prioritize and categorize requirements or issues to ensure that effective delivery of projects or enhancements Skills (Non-Technical) Must have resilience and the ability to work well under pressure with minimum guidance Quick learner, adaptable to changes on project needs and good team player who take initiative to help team to complete assigned task Ability to handle multiple concurrent activities and projects Strong communication skills as need to interaction closely with various stakeholders from product, delivery lead to technical counterparts across other applications Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Summary At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services and customer experiences. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. We’re perfectionists. Idealists. Inventors. Forever tinkering with products and processes, always on the lookout for a better way. A job at Apple is one that requires a lot of you, but it’s also one that rewards forward-thinking, original thinking and hard work. None of us at Apple would have it any other way. This is a unique opportunity for you to be part of a team that manages critical B2B platforms for integrating with Apple's external partners such as Manufacturers, logistics providers, banks, resellers and business customers! We are seeking a technically strong hands-on individual with a passion for provisioning and operating critical services at scale. The individual will be responsible for setting up infrastructure, deployments, monitoring, patching and providing L2 support for multiple services. The position requires partnering with extraordinary engineers in Apple's information security, network and compute teams to build secure, permanent and reliable solutions. Key Qualifications Solid foundation in Webmethods Integration server and Webmethods Trading Networks. Good understanding of Oracle database and performance tuning, analysis of database metrics, query performance. First-hand experience in performance tuning of Java applications, JVM garbage collection. Solid programming experience in Java or Python and shell scripts. Knowledge of HTTP/S, TCP, DNS and application load balancing. Good understanding of basic security concepts and protocols - authentication, authorization, signing, encryption, TLS, SSH/SFTP, PKI, X509 certificates and PGP. Knowledge of EDI, AS2 protocol, Webmethods SAP adaptors is preferred but not required. Experience with a CI/CD tools such Ansible, Puppet, Jenkins, Spinnaker will be a plus. Knowledge of PCI, SOX Compliance requirements for IT systems will be a plus. Job Description We are looking for a Site Reliability Engineering role passionate about provisioning, securing and scaling services for integrating Apple and its B2B partners while maintaining performance, availability and capacity! It is a hands-on role for managing day to day operations tasks such as code deployments, configuration changes, security, supervising and alerting as well as providing second level of support for any production issues. In addition to operational tasks, you will also work on longer term projects for automating application infrastructure setup and configuration management. You will be responsible for coordinating multiple middleware applications running primarily on Webmethods servers and using frontend load balancers, Oracle DB and object storage services. You will be managing applications that handle a wide variety of B2B data related to Apple's supply chain such as shipments, forecasts, manufacturing data, invoices, and supplier information. The ideal candidate should have both good systems, operations and automation skills as well as experience dealing with performance and security issues in a production environment. Technical expertise, good interpersonal skills and teamwork are critical requirements for this role as it involves working with both technical and non-technical groups within Apple. Additional Information Apple is an Equal Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Apple will not discriminate or retaliate against applicants who inquire about, disclose, or discuss their compensation or that of other applicants. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

The Shift Team Leader leads optimal and safe terminal operations by managing routine process and utilities operations during his shift and monitoring the terminal’s performance. He is responsible for executing the activity plan and schedule and controls to effect and efficient the task process to meet product quantity and quality targets. The Shift Team Leader supervises staff and contractors’ compliance with Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) and Environmental Management System (EMS) requirements and participates in WSH/EMS incident investigations. He leads emergency response as the Site Incident Controller (SIC) of the organization’s Emergency Response Team (ERT). In addition, he takes charge of his shift team personnel capability development by providing coaching and mentoring. He interacts effectively with others and has good communication, analytical and problem solving skills. Job Description 1. Administer Workplace Safety and Health (WSH) and Fire and Safety Management System (FSMS) Supervise compliance with WSH/EMS systems Supervise the conduct of activity-based risk assessments Supervise the execution of Safe System of Work (SSoW) procedures Supervise toolbox, shift take/handover talks prior to start/end of the duty shift work activities. Participate in WSH/EMS incident investigations Supervise contractors to ensure compliance with terminal’s WSH/FSM standards and practices Supervise good housekeeping in the workplace 2. Manage Emergency Response and Crisis Lead emergency response as the Site Incident Controller (SIC) Assist the organization’s crisis management teams to continually improve the crisis management plan 3. Perform Activity Process and Utilities Operations Support the development and implementation of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) Supervise start-up, monitoring, control and shutdown of the activity units and utilities at the control room and facility site Supervise troubleshooting during all modes of operation including activity upset conditions Supervise the preparation of process equipment and work area for mechanical, maintenance and turnaround work Review data trends and analysis to monitor terminal’s performance Monitor and control activity process to meet product quantity and quality targets Supervise the application of emerging technology for process operational tasks within team Execute activity plan and schedule Use new data technology to review terminal operations and equipment performance Supervise the operation of automation technology to perform terminal optimization. 4. Administer Staff and Organizational Development Identify opportunities for continuous improvement Support implementation of continuous improvement initiatives and activities Coach and mentor staff Manage resources within team Job Requirements Minimum experience of 3 (three) years in terminal or industrial supervision Minimum 5 (five) years of experience in the field and or control room of terminal or industry activities

Job_Title: VP / AVP, Business Analyst & Program Coordinator | (WD29805)
Job_Descriptions: VP / AVP, Business Analyst & Program Coordinator (Future of Work), Transformation Group - (WD29805) Business Function: Thinking People-First, Always! Here at the DBS Transformation Group, we focus on nurturing the culture of the “World’s Best Digital Bank” (Euromoney, 2016 & 2018) and Best Bank in the World (Euromoney 2019). Our approach is a combination of both science and art; we immerse our stakeholders in the world of design thinking and experimentation, drive rigorous creativity along our pipeline, and build connections between corporate entrepreneurs and start-ups. We are a cross-disciplinary team focused on the invention of solutions that will radically improve the way people live, work and play.  We are passionate and committed to make banking joyful (while having lots of fun)! Be part of this transformational journey as we shape the Future of Work together. We are seeking a Business Analyst / Program Coordinator in analysing current landscape and trends vis-à-vis user requirements, support the governance for Workbench program that will align critical functions / activities to enable and empower the bank with an efficient, reusable, and resilient infrastructure across all BUs and SUs. The ideal person enjoys solving complex problems, thinking about the future, working with cross-functional teams and designing suitable solutions, framework and approach. The incumbent plays a critical role looking into the employee journeys and processes to deliver a frictionless journey for all employees. Responsibilities: Understand the voice of employee and partner with internal stakeholders to capture the concerns/pain points of employees and recommend solutions, design processes and opportunities with employee in mind Be creative, customer obsessed and passionate about pioneering new initiatives that delight employees and enhance their experience at work Work closely with Change Management team to ensure timely change management communications across the bank. Active participation in delivery squad from Inception workshop, Development sprint cycle, Deployment activities and Post Support Work closely with business, technology and other relevant stakeholders to ensure that all stakeholders and engaged and actively managed Business Analysis Gather, clarify and study business requirements Perform data analysis and data mapping Prepare, review test scenarios and data for completeness and coverage Provide clarity of requirements through all phases in agile delivery squad, from Inception workshop, Development Sprint cycle, Deployment and Post support Program Coordination Support program governance for Workbenches Establish a strong program governance strategy & change management mindset through effective communication, collaboration and engagement with all stakeholders Ensure governance on roles & responsibilities of the various program roles, and program success-metrics Requirements: Bachelor Degree  with a minimum 5 years of experience in working with business analysis and / or program governance is preferred. Experience in running AGILE sprints Knowledge of SDLC, DBS core systems, familiarity with Platform construct will be an added advantage A self-starter and collaborator who is meticulous and analytical, and able to manage a fast-paced, ever-changing, and deadline-driven environment Experience with content management system and project management Passion for building communities and connecting individuals Excellent facilitation, presentation and written communication skills. Flexibility and resilience in responding to multiple changing priorities Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Job_Title: O&T Transition Services Program Management Senior Lead
Job_Descriptions: O&T Transition Services Program Management Senior Lead As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients' best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Enterprise Operations & Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do. We keep the bank safe and provide the technical tools our workers need to be successful. We design our digital architecture and ensure our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. Our operations teams manage risk, resources, and program management. We focus on enterprise resiliency and business continuity. We develop, coordinate, and execute strategic operational plans. Essentially, Enterprise Operations & Technology re-engineers' client and partner processes to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and controlled services. This Senior Program Manager position is responsible for overseeing the fulfilment of the Transitional Service Agreement (TSA) activities for Operations and Technology associated with the Consumer Divestiture, working in conjunction with the wider regional program team. The Senior TSA Program Manager will be the first point of contact for the buyer throughout the TSA period. They will participate in and lead relevant governance committees to ensure appropriate governance, coordinate billing for the services provided, manage entitlements and access and partner with groups across EO&T including Citi Shared Services, Citi Technology Infrastructure, Global Functions Technology, the Chief Information Security Office, Citi Reality Services, Records Management, Continuity of Business Services, the Resource Management Office and the Citi Solutions Centers. The successful candidate requires a comprehensive understanding of the Asia business and Operations and Technology - including how they interact in order to achieve the objectives of the function. The successful candidate will: be accountable for the delivery of the separation plan for O&T for the multi-market buyer; apply their in-depth understanding of the business impact of technical contributions. require strong commercial awareness have excellent communication skills in order to negotiate internally, and with the buyer often at a senior level; manage and maintain strong records and governance; Responsibilities: Supports planning, directing and coordination of day-to-day activities of running Damselfly for O&T. Identifies stakeholders and key organizations and build and manage relationships. Directs the creation of multiple programs of work and manage their alignment to business goals. Leads the facilitation, coordination, and arbitration of cross-functional macro level topics within/across programs and with Senior Management. Leads the identification and drive resolution of issues, including those outside established programs of work. Works with stakeholders to ensure program scope definition meets business objectives. Drives adherence to program processes, procedures, methods, and standards for program delivery and leverage across the program. Directs the communication of status, issue, and risk disposition to all stakeholders, including senior management, on a timely basis. Directs the identification of risks which impact program delivery and ensure mitigation strategies are developed and executed when necessary. Manages multiple teams or a functional area (depending on size of business). Applies comprehensive understanding of concepts and procedures within own area and basic knowledge of other areas to resolve issues that have impact beyond own area. Ensures creation and signoff of program plan and charter, benefits management plan, stakeholder management plan, acceptance plan, and central program issue log. Ensures program plans meet business needs as described in the program initiation documents. Ensures all stakeholders are identified and included in scope definition activities, understand the program schedule and key milestones and receive schedule status regularly. Ensures funding has been approved for the program. Ensures all areas of the program are appropriately staffed. Ensures program commitment from those assigning resources. Escalates program risks to the Program Director, or Program Sponsor, when appropriate. Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency. Qualifications: 12+ years of experience Technical expert and known internally and externally as reliable, knowledgeable resource. Clear understanding of Citi's' different businesses and the related economics. Education: Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve globally from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We'll enable growth and progress together. Job Family Group: Project and Program Management Job Family: Program Management Time Type: Full time Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi") invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi . Job_Title: VP, Digital, Data & Technology Program Team Lead, CRESA Group Strategy and Solutions, Technology & Operation - (WD31028)
Job_Descriptions: Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels. About CRESA Department DBS Corporate Real Estate Strategy & Administration team (CRESA) is the custodian of DBS' real estate assets while helping to drive the work culture and improve employee experience for the bank. Beyond cost & space optimization, we transform spaces using Digital and Data to foster a culture of collaboration, innovation & teamwork. Globally, we manage more than 5 million square feet of space, ranging from office spaces to more than 750 retail locations.  For office spaces, our main goal is to find and build a collaborative workspace to allow colleagues to collaborate and innovate and to drive the culture of the bank. For retail locations, we source and select the best sites, negotiate for the best lease terms and design and build workspaces to achieve the best customer journey & experiences. Above all, our team is also the champion of the bank's environmental sustainability programme, keeping both the office & retail locations as sustainable as we can to build the Best Bank for a Better World. About DDDOM Team in CRESA We are a diverse team comprising technology and data science individuals from related business fields with an aim to use our combined expertise to support our corporate real estate team. We want to embark on this by being digitally-wired, using  data to power our real estate decisions and operations while obsessing ourselves with the employee experience. CRESA aims to create innovative space experiences that matter in order to drive the desired culture of DBS and this team will bring the best of Digital  Tools  and  Data  Analytics  to improve the dynamics of space experiences, services and the systems that encompasses it. About the role We are looking for an experienced, hands-on, Digital Applications and Technology Lead who will support the DDDOM (Digital Data Driven Operating Model) Team in CRESA, within the Technology & Operations unit in DBS. The Digital Applications and Technology Lead is expected to help drive the acquisition and onboarding of digital solution using Agile project management methodology and contribute to the overall creation of  the  digital  applications. The role  requires  good  understanding  and  application of Agile project management skills and deep knowledge of digital workplace tools and data acquisition tools. The Digital Applications and Technology Lead needs to collaborate with DBS' technology partner and external technology  vendors to develop/ maintain Digital Applications to augment CRE functions. Application systems production environment encompasses multiple application software solutions such as Data Governance/Data Quality tool, IoT application platform, IoT sensors, Space Management tool etc., supporting real estate project management, facilities management & lease management. Responsibilities Lead & drive key projects along with internal IT partner & support DDDOM Head for program management Represent CRE in monthly project steering committee forums with IT Partners. Work with internal CRESA business stakeholders to present/update project status, budget drawdown and present projects for approval to proceed etc. in monthly project steering committee forum Work with DDDOM Finance to support DDDOM Head for yearly IT budgeting exercise ensuring all CRESA IT projects/enhancements are accounted for and successfully submitted in GENE system (Bank-wide project budgeting tool) Maintain strong working relationships with key stakeholder teams: Internal business stakeholders, Internal IT Partner/infrastructure/information security and external vendors. Expected to drive improvements through influence and strong relationships with managers in other teams, often who need to execute the changes Run day-to-day functional and business technology support (for CRESA's existing application systems in production) including incident and problem management, root cause analysis while always looking for opportunities to improve processes and controls Correlate events/data across multiple systems to proactively surface and resolve issues Be the go-to person for internal business stakeholders before the projects are being put up for discussion with the Internal IT partners/seniors of the bank Provide business analysis, project management & consultancy and manage software application projects with internal business stakeholders Work with internal IT partner to support project team in vendor management to ensure contractual obligations are met and projects are successfully delivered by vendors    Lead & drive vendor & Internal IT partner to report progress and status of the projects and escalate issues/ challenges to the project sponsor/relevant parties Requirements Degree in Business IT or Computer & Information Science or equivalent with minimum 8 years of solution architect experience working  in  banking  or financial  institutions  within  IT  industry Prior experience in large scale enterprise application development, capacity planning, optimization, re-engineering, and performance fine tuning - will be an advantage Relevant domain knowledge in implementing technology solution within financial institutions preferred SCRUM Master Certified preferred with experience in agile project implementation and sound knowledge of agile project implementation methodologies Program  management  (includes  business  case  development, IT  budget  process management, vendor management and contract governance management) Working knowledge of cyber and information security and cloud computing & services Business analysis and/or hands-on digital transformation experience preferred Strong problem solving and program execution skills while being process oriented Understanding of system resiliency and redundancy requirements Have a strong desire to mentor and coach the teams to continue increasing organization's capabilities Good interpersonal and communication skills, able to communicate well with business users/partners Ability to work well in a team and possess good team management skills. Hands-on attitude towards work with sense of urgency Knowledge of disaster recovery, system backup and restoration methods Knowledge of virtualization technologies/containers, cloud solution implementation (AWS, Azure and/or Google Cloud etc.) Apply Now We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Indonesia Demand Generation Marketing Specialist Opportunity with one of the largest US Tech MNC Visibility to senior management Exposure to one of the faster growing regions As Indonesia Demand Generation Marketing Specialist, you'll build and execute the demand generation strategy in Indonesia to drive Cloud, adoption and customer success through extensive, integrated online, offline, direct and indirect go-to-market programs. You will be involved in building an engaged customer base and actively working with a direct sales team on scalable enterprise and start-up marketing activities across multiple segments, channels, geographies and phases of the customer lifecycle relationship. Role Description: The Cloud Marketing team is responsible for raising awareness and interest about Cloud among developers, start-ups and enterprises everywhere and guiding these individuals through a seamless customer journey, from interest to discovery, trial, commitment and advocacy, fueling market share growth. Looking for a demand generation marketing specialist to support Indonesia marketing strategy and operations. You will be driving activities to build Cloud awareness, new business acquisition, customer development and user community programs. You will have a proven track record of overachieving marketing objectives and able to establish credibility with the sales team and global marketing colleagues through their market insights, industry knowledge, communication skills and their leadership and vision. Responsibilities: Work closely with the sales teams and Demand Management team to drive opportunity and business growth. Develop, execute, rollout and optimize new customer acquisition campaigns and programs aligned to horizontal and vertical solutions including Cloud Platform events, outbound campaigns, external trade shows and customer stories. Grow awareness, familiarity and perception for Cloud Platform among key influencer organizations. Enable partners to scale coverage for Cloud services and build community programs to build deep loyalty with end users and advocates. Skill/Experience/Education Mandatory BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience. Min 5-8 years of relevant B2B marketing or field marketing experience. Desired Understanding of the enterprise software purchase, development and implementation cycles; Computer Science or development experience Experience or understanding of developer audience; Strong technical acumen, ability to interact with highly technical people and technologies Strong project management skills and experience, including managing external creative agencies, events vendors, and international projects; Experience planning and executing multiple, complex marketing programs including budget management Strong communication skills in both business and technical situations, comfortability in talking about technical things with technical people and able to express complex concepts in plain language to reach broader audiences For more information you can email Jessica Lee in our Singapore office on jessica.lee@teksystems.com quoting Job Reference 527271 or alternatively, apply here to register your interest. http://jobs.en-sg.teksystems.com/cEqxM9/indonesia-demand-generation-marketing-specialist-sales-marketing-singapore-singapore-14818977 Allegis Group Singapore Pte Ltd, Company Reg No. 200909448N, EA License No. 10C4544

Job_Title: Client Service Manager - HSBC Global Asset Management
Job_Descriptions: The health and safety of our employees and candidates is very important to us. Due to the current situation related to the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), we’re leveraging our digital capabilities to ensure we can continue to recruit top talent at HSBC.  As your application progresses, you may be asked to use one of our digital tools to help you through your recruitment journey.  If so, one of our Resourcing colleagues will explain how our video-interviewing technology will be used throughout the recruitment process and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have. Some careers have more impact than others. If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. Global Asset Management, the investment management business of the HSBC Group, serves HSBC’s worldwide customer base of retail and private clients, intermediaries, corporates and institutions invested in both segregated accounts and pooled funds. Global Asset Management fulfils its purpose of connecting HSBC’s clients with investment opportunities around the world through an international network of offices in approximately 30 countries, delivering global capabilities with local market insight. We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as a Client Service Manager. Principal Responsibilities Deliver effective client servicing and demonstrable control over the client relationships, including regular updates and reporting to clients Work closely with stakeholders and other offices to deliver Client/Prospects requests/ initiatives, explore process efficiency and client solutions Provide support to new business opportunities and product development discussions with regards to client requirements for their investments Manage all operations related issues of Institutional Business clients, in particular insurance clients Support KYC, client onboarding, transaction monitoring and reviews Where there is room for improvement, explore process efficiency and better client solutions Ensure compliance with all laws, rules, regulations and procedures, in accordance with best market practice Requirements Client Services experience in the asset management industry, preferably within the Institutional Business space Solid analytical and problem solving skills Strong communications and negotiation skills Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively with colleagues from diverse background and of varying seniority Be independent and resourceful in other words, a self-starter 5 to 8 years of working experience Proficient in Excel spreadsheets and PowerPoint presentations To be considered for this role, the relevant rights to work in Singapore is required. The chosen candidate for this role will be required to undergo enhanced vetting. Subject to local laws, this will require the individual to satisfactorily pass a series of additional checks as part of the recruitment process and on an ongoing basis, if appointed to the role. HSBC Group reserves its position with regards to any steps which it may take in relation to any material adverse findings which arise either when the checks are originally completed, and/or if relevant, on an ongoing basis. You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC. www.hsbc.com/careers HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website. Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited.
